Posts.Content: Hi Sara After my first one I had a couple of days of feeling low and weepy, but then I did pick up and felt a lot better. But after this second one, it has been far more intense and debilitating and now eleven days in and can't honestly say I am feeling any better. I am going to have a review on Friday with my Onc, because like you I'm not sure I can go on. Sorry if this isn't very encouraging but I do know everyone reacts differently and you might just pick up any day now. Good luck Honey Love Jac xxxx
Posts.Title: Feeling very Depressed on Docetaxel

Posts.Content: Hi Mother47 Thank you for your comments, I really would struggle with out this site, after stamping my feet and saying that I didn't want to have anymore Chemo, I am now done to have my 3 Tax on Wednesday, I am now on antidepressant and fingers crossed that I won't get so low as I did last time. Just wondering how you are going on with your 3rd one, I really hope it's not been to bad for you. Love Jac
Posts.Title: Feeling very Depressed on Docetaxel

Posts.Content: After starting this Chemo journey really determined and positive, I can't be leave how I have plummeted into feeling very low, I am so weepy and have lost all focus on what I am doing. I use to be quite strong and up beat but this is the most horrendous thing I have been through. Sorry to be so negative, Love Jac xx
Posts.Title: Feeling very Depressed on Docetaxel

Posts.Content: Hi Sue Thanks for your post, it's so lovely how you ladies come to our aid. I was just wondering is their any thing that they can give you which can boost your mood when they give it to you, my brestcare nurse said for energy levels they can increase the steroids or give them for longer soi wonder if they have mood enhancers, or maybe just wishful thinking. I suppose antidepressant but they will take a while to get into your system. Thanks for your help Love Jac xxx
Posts.Title: Feeling very Depressed on Docetaxel

Posts.Content: Hi Sascha You have made me feel tons better with your comment, I have been thinking if it's big it might have been their for ages and I have just missed it, so it must be everywhere, I get my results Friday so praying it will just be a regional recurrence,this waiting for results is like torture. I am now going to read about your type of cancer as don't know anything about it. Thanks for your reply xx
Posts.Title: screening mammography

Posts.Content: Hi Sascha New to this site so not sure I am replying in the correct place, you asked if the cancer is in the lymph glands or lymph nodes I think glands it is under my arm, so they are going to remove all my lymph glands. I had a CT scan yesterday to check if it has spread, but because it feels quite a big lump I am terrified it has, but will know soon enough. I also have had a mammogram every year and they have all been clear. So feeling a bit fustrated along with all the other feelings. Thanks for your help Jac xx
Posts.Title: screening mammography

Posts.Content: Thanks Hon I think that might be the same with me, as they start really easily, if they carry on I will contact the dr for some thanks Jac xx
Posts.Title: Nose bleeds while having chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Guys, Just wondering if nose bleeds are normal, I had my first Chemo on the 9th (Taxotere) and have every side effect on the list, but have had 4 nose bleeds and they are rather heavy, and Honest wasn't picking just blowing !!. Thanks Jac xxxx
Posts.Title: Nose bleeds while having chemo

Posts.Content: Thanks Dorothee That makes sence, I just don't know at the moment what's going to happen next. Will defo keep away from the unblocking meds, now. My Dad always told me that life was just a bowel of cherries, I am beginning to think he was right little liar !!! And him a Minister too !!! Hee hee Thanks Jac xxxx
Posts.Title: Nose bleeds while having chemo
